Title: More LNG projects need to come on stream in 2029-2030: Shell
Description: The global LNG market's current structural tightness will continue for at least a couple of years until the next big wave of new supplies from North America comes on stream in 2025-2027. But there is a need for more projects to come on stream in 2029-2030, and what happens this year and next year will determine how quickly these projects get filled or not, according to Shell's executive vice president for energy marketing Steve Hill.
Author: DE

Title: Centrica to keep UK’s largest gas storage facility open next winter
Description: British energy company Centrica plans to keep the UK’s largest gas storage facility Rough open next winter. The firm started using Rough as storage again in late October to support the country’s security of supply amid the severe gas shortages facing Europe.
Author: DE

Title: Global LNG market to remain tight and exposed to demand shocks: Shell
Description: Shell expects the global LNG market to remain tight and exposed to supply and demand shocks, with competition between Europe and Asia for limited new LNG supplies seen intensifying over the next two years.
Author: CK

Title: Turkey’s new LNG import terminal at Saros poised to receive Vasant 1 FSRU
Description: The Swan Energy-owned 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage and regasification unit has arrived in Turkey’s Saros Bay and is scheduled to arrive in two days at state-owned Botas’ new Saros LNG import terminal to start operations.
Author: CK
